title: Authors and Citation
text: Adam Sadowski. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sadowski (2023). megamation: Functions downloading Megamation data directly R. https://github.com/asadow/megamation, https://asadow.github.io/megamation/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {megamation: Functions for downloading Megamation data directly in R},   author = {Adam Sadowski},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/asadow/megamation, https://asadow.github.io/megamation/}, }

what: Functions for downloading Megamation data directly in R
title: Functions for downloading Megamation data directly in R
text: goal megamation facilitate Megamation data downloads R. wraps REST API API endpoint (URL parameters) becomes R function documented arguments. megamation also contains implements functions Expose important details HTTP errors R errors. Provide paginate function large downloads. Caches responses GET requests status code 200 least one standard caching headers (e.g. Expires, Etag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control)

title: Functions for downloading Megamation data directly in R
text: can install development version megamation GitHub :

title: Functions for downloading Megamation data directly in R
text: Megamation representative provide key URL. helper function provided install credentials (creates name-value pairs .Renviron file, safe place secrets.) Edit run function :

title: Functions for downloading Megamation data directly in R
text: set credentials , can open .Renviron (usethis::edit_r_environ()) enter NAME = "VALUE" separate lines like . need restart R load . can use Sys.setenv(NAME = "VALUE").

title: Functions for downloading Megamation data directly in R
text: credentials installed, can request endpoint using mm_pull(). request "trade" endpoint.

title: Functions for downloading Megamation data directly in R
text: mm_req() allows define request endpoint resource: "timecard", "workorder", etc. can optionally paginate request using mm_req_paginate(). run httr2::req_dry_run() show exactly httr2 send server, without actually sending .
code: library(megamation) req <- mm_req("timecard", date = I("<>09-01-2023,09-02-2023")) # req <- req |> mm_req_paginate() req |> httr2::req_dry_run() #> GET /uog/dl/timecard?DATE=<>09-01-2023,09-02-2023 HTTP/1.1 #> Host: api.megamation.com #> User-Agent: megamation (https://github.com/asadow/megamation) #> Accept: */* #> Accept-Encoding: deflate, gzip #> Authorization: <REDACTED>

title: Functions for downloading Megamation data directly in R
text: added pagination, use mm_req_paginate_perform() perform request. , use httr2::req_perform(). value returned Megamation API response. body response contain raw bytes. can parsed using mm_parse(). parsed response list includes data. interested data, can skip mm_parse() simply use mm_resp_data().
code: resp <- req |> httr2::req_perform()  df <- resp |> mm_resp_data()

what: Install Megamation credentials in your .Renviron file for repeated use — mm_set_creds
title: Install Megamation credentials in your .Renviron file for repeated use — mm_set_creds
text: function adds Megamation API key base URL .Renviron file can called securely without stored code. installed two credentials, can called time Sys.getenv("MEGAMATION_KEY") Sys.getenv("MEGAMATION_URL"). .Renviron file, function create one . already .Renviron file, function append key existing file, making backup original file disaster recovery purposes.

title: Install Megamation credentials in your .Renviron file for repeated use — mm_set_creds
Install Megamation credentials in your .Renviron file for repeated use — mm_set_creds
text: key API key provided Megamation formatted quotes. url API URL provided Megamation formatted quotes. overwrite TRUE, overwrite existing Megamation credentials already .Renviron file.

title: Install Megamation credentials in your .Renviron file for repeated use — mm_set_creds
code: if (FALSE) { mm_set_creds(   key = "<YOUR-MEGAMATION_KEY>",   url = "<YOUR-MEGAMATION_URL>" ) # Reload your environment so you can use the credentials # without restarting R readRenviron("~/.Renviron") # You can check it with: Sys.getenv("MEGAMATION_KEY")  # If you need to overwrite existing credentials: mm_set_creds(   key = "<YOUR-MEGAMATION_KEY>",   url = "<YOUR-MEGAMATION_URL>",   overwrite = TRUE ) # Reload your environment to use the credentials }
